entry.content:

  • Sergei Pourmal
  • Melissa E. Truong
  • Ishan Deshpande
Article30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Pharmacologic restoration of GTP hydrolysis by mutant RAS (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Pharmacologic restoration of GTP hydrolysis by mutant RAS

  • Antonio Cuevas-Navarro
  • Yasin Pourfarjam
  • Piro Lito
Article30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Endogenous self-peptides guard immune privilege of the central nervous system (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Endogenous self-peptides guard immune privilege of the central nervous system

  • Min Woo Kim
  • Wenqing Gao
  • Jonathan Kipnis
Article30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Polyclonal-to-monoclonal transition in colorectal precancerous evolution (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Polyclonal-to-monoclonal transition in colorectal precancerous evolution

Experiments using DNA barcoding for lineage tracing in mouse models of colorectal cancer reveal polyclonal origins of premalignant lesions, with a transition to monoclonality as they progress to the advanced tumour.

  • Zhaolian Lu
  • Shanlan Mo
  • Zheng Hu
Article30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Smooth trends in fermium charge radii and the impact of shell effects (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Smooth trends in fermium charge radii and the impact of shell effects

Laser spectroscopy measurements of the fermium isotopic chain show a smooth trend in the nuclear size of heavy actinide elements, and diminishing shell effects on the size evolution compared with lighter nuclei.

  • Jessica Warbinek
  • Elisabeth Rickert
  • Klaus Wendt
ArticleOpen Access30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Polyclonality overcomes fitness barriers in Apc-driven tumorigenesis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Polyclonality overcomes fitness barriers in Apc-driven tumorigenesis

Multicolour lineage tracing and mutagenesis studies in a mouse model show that many intestinal tumours are polyclonal, with multiple clones exhibiting independent Apc mutations driven by differences in KRAS and MYC signalling.

  • Iannish D. Sadien
  • Sam Adler
  • Douglas J. Winton
ArticleOpen Access30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Scalable ultrastrong MXene films with superior osteogenesis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Scalable ultrastrong MXene films with superior osteogenesis

Large-scale roll-to-roll-assisted blade coating is used in the production of scalable ultrastong MXene films with superior mechanical, electromagnetic shielding and bone regeneration properties.

  • Sijie Wan
  • Ying Chen
  • Qunfeng Cheng
Article30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Design of customized coronavirus receptors (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Design of customized coronavirus receptors

A strategy using engineered functional customized viral receptors enables the development of functional infection models for coronaviruses whose native cellular receptors are unknown.

  • Peng Liu
  • Mei-Ling Huang
  • Huan Yan
Article30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Myocardial infarction augments sleep to limit cardiac inflammation and damage (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Myocardial infarction augments sleep to limit cardiac inflammation and damage

Studies in humans and mice show that myocardial infarction recruits monocytes to the brain’s thalamus, promoting sleep, which in turn restricts cardiac inflammation and sympathetic signalling and assists healing.

  • Pacific Huynh
  • Jan D. Hoffmann
  • Cameron S. McAlpine
Article30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Dynamic interface printing (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Dynamic interface printing

Dynamic interface printing is a new form of 3D printing that leverages an acoustically modulated, constrained air–liquid boundary to rapidly generate centimetre-scale 3D structures within tens of seconds.

  • Callum Vidler
  • Michael Halwes
  • David J. Collins
ArticleOpen Access30 Oct 2024

entry.title: The genomic natural history of the aurochs (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
The genomic natural history of the aurochs

An analysis of 38 ancient genomes from the aurochs, the extinct ancestor of modern cattle, provides insight into the population ancestry and domestication of this species.

  • Conor Rossi
  • Mikkel-Holger S. Sinding
  • Daniel G. Bradley
Article30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Vertical bedrock shifts reveal summer water storage in Greenland ice sheet (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Vertical bedrock shifts reveal summer water storage in Greenland ice sheet

Analysis of bedrock elastic deformation using high-resolution observations from 22 Greenland GNSS Network stations shows that the Greenland ice sheet buffers enough summer meltwater englacially to cause subsidence of about 5 mm during the melt season.

  • Jiangjun Ran
  • Pavel Ditmar
  • Tonie van Dam
ArticleOpen Access30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Rhythmic IL-17 production by γδ T cells maintains adipose de novo lipogenesis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Rhythmic IL-17 production by γδ T cells maintains adipose de novo lipogenesis

Innate IL-17-producing T cells—in particular, adipose γδ17 T cells—are enriched in molecular-clock genes, and the circadian expression of IL-17A and RORγt by these cells has a role in maintaining local homeostasis and regulating lipogenesis.

  • Aaron Douglas
  • Brenneth Stevens
  • Lydia Lynch
ArticleOpen Access30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Progressive plasticity during colorectal cancer metastasis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Progressive plasticity during colorectal cancer metastasis

Colorectal cancer metastasis involves dramatic plasticity and loss of PROX1-mediated repression of non-intestinal lineages.

  • A. R. Moorman
  • E. K. Benitez
  • K. Ganesh
ArticleOpen Access30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Leptin-activated hypothalamic BNC2 neurons acutely suppress food intake (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Leptin-activated hypothalamic BNC2 neurons acutely suppress food intake

We find that leptin-target neurons expressing basonuclin 2 in the arcuate nucleus that acutely suppress appetite by directly inhibiting agouti-related protein neurons are a key component of the neural circuit that maintains energy balance.

  • Han L. Tan
  • Luping Yin
  • Jeffrey M. Friedman
ArticleOpen Access30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Temporal recording of mammalian development and precancer (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Temporal recording of mammalian development and precancer

Using a multipurpose, single-cell CRISPR platform, we demonstrate precise timing of tissue-specific cell expansion during mouse embryonic development, unconventional developmental relationships between cell types, new epithelial progenitor states and insights into precancer initiation by leveraging genetic histories.

  • Mirazul Islam
  • Yilin Yang
  • Ken S. Lau
ArticleOpen Access30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Softening of the optical phonon by reduced interatomic bonding strength without depolarization (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Softening of the optical phonon by reduced interatomic bonding strength without depolarization

An alternative route to drive the transverse optical phonon softening sheds light on developing a unified theory for ferroelectricity enhancement in ultrathin films free from depolarization fields using ionic radius differences and strains, among other methods.

  • Ruyue Cao
  • Qiao-Lin Yang
  • Jun-Wei Luo
Article30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Tumour evolution and microenvironment interactions in 2D and 3D space (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Tumour evolution and microenvironment interactions in 2D and 3D space

Visium spatial transcriptomics, single-nucleus RNA sequencing and co-detection by indexing are used to identify distinct spatial microregions in tumours and their microenvironment across six diverse solid cancer types.

  • Chia-Kuei Mo
  • Jingxian Liu
  • Li Ding
ArticleOpen Access30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Single phage proteins sequester signals from TIR and cGAS-like enzymes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Single phage proteins sequester signals from TIR and cGAS-like enzymes

Phage Thoeris anti-defence proteins Tad1 and Tad2 both achieve anti-CBASS activity by simultaneously sequestering CBASS cyclic oligonucleotides.

  • Dong Li
  • Yu Xiao
  • Yue Feng
Article30 Oct 2024

entry.title: Phonon modes and electron–phonon coupling at the FeSe/SrTiO3 interface (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Phonon modes and electron–phonon coupling at the FeSe/SrTiO3 interface

Phonons at the FeSe/STO interface are imaged at atomic scale, uncovering new optical phonon modes that couple strongly with electrons, shedding light on the microscopic origin of the interfacial EPC and providing insights into achieving superconducting transition temperature enhancement.

  • Hongbin Yang
  • Yinong Zhou
  • Xiaoqing Pan
Article30 Oct 2024
